sub_title: Human Capital Lead for Energy, Resources & Industrials sector; Manager at Deloitte Nederland specialising in Digital Enablement and Behavioural Science
summary:
Victoria Coady is a Manager in the Organizational Transformation offering of Deloitte’s Human Capital Consultancy practice in the Netherlands, specializing in Change Management.  In this capacity, she creatively engages with senior HR departments in providing advisory and practical skills during HR transformations.

Bringing a diverse background to her consulting practice, she has worked internationally in Europe, Australia, and the United States. Victoria commits wide-ranging industry experience to her consulting work stemming from a career in arts administration and later operational human resources in the technology media & telecommunications space. Her clients run the gamut from public sector to automotive, supermarkets to insurance providers.

Victoria has experience as both a client and consultant on large-scale S/4HANA and SAPSuccessFactors implementations. She has a proven track record in digital enablement and strategic change management, organization design implementation, (leadership) training journeys and capability development, cultural transformation, communications and stakeholder engagement and data-driven change.

She also brings a behavioral science angle to her work, exploring the root drivers for adoption and helping clients to understand how behavior influences the embedding of change, and setting conditions for new behaviors to thrive.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Fine Arts (B.F.A.) - Theatre Management & Administration

projects.title: Health Insurance Industry Client - HR Technology Transformation/ Implementation
projects.description:
HR technology implementation for a large industry-leading health insurance client in Australia. Part of a wide-ranging team including consultants, contractors, and client representatives implementing HR, procurement and finance systems utilising the SAP suite of products (SAP SuccessFactors/ SAP Ariba/ SAP S4HANA). The core HR suite would be integrated with multiple third party legacy software solutions requiring extensive integrations development.

Consultant as part of the HR workstream, specialising in Integrations and Data Management. Also fulfilled role of Reporting Lead for HR.

- Managed creation of master data design documentation for Core HR, Payroll & Time systems
- Maintained master data design documentation through iterative design and build stages
- Revised all L3 HR process documentation to align with business process changes during blueprint phase
- Managed development of integration functional specifications for over 25 native and third-party interfaces across HR systems
- Facilitated handover process of functional specifications to offshore development teams by leading client/consultant/developer workshops
- Created and managed project plan for unit testing of reporting functionality across multile HR modules
- Led Unit Testing of reporting across multiple HR software systems
- Mentored Summer Vacationer student during 4-week work placement on client site

projects.title: HR Tech Fest 2016
projects.description:
Organized Deloitte Australia HR Technology & Transformation team presence at annual HR Tech Fest Conference held at Crown Casino in Melbourne.

- Collaborated on project plan including booth setup, marketing plan, and team-wide attendance
- Issued department-wide communications plan to build internal engagement and amplification across digital channels of conference activities
- Managed partner involvement for booth-based networking as well as keynote speaker engagement
- Developed and implemented social media strategy amplifying scheduled and live posting
- Created a live scrolling Twitter wall to showcase engagement across conference activities using our unique hashtag #DeloitteHRT
- Ran successful Twitter competition to interact with conference attendees
- Planned and executed client dinner event

profile_positions.description:
One of my favorite roles at Deloitte is as a Faculty Lecturer at Deloitte Univeristy EMEA near Brussels, Belgium. I have been on the faculty for the now discontinued Technology Consultant Milestone (2019) and will continue to facilitate the EMEA Explore Cross- Consulting Milestone (2022-Present)
Overall course facilitation for newly promoted Consultants across the EMEA region and consulting service lines, in addition to Elective courses (Strategic Thinking, Managing Difficult Conversations, Productivity in a Fluid Environment)
profile_positions.title: Deloitte University EMEA Faculty Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Victoria Coady is a Senior Consultant at Deloitte Consulting and works in the Organizational Transformation offering of Deloitte’s Human Capital practice in the Netherlands, specializing in Change Management. She has experience across industry sectors such as Consumer, Insurance and Public sectors. Victoria has 3 years of experience in Change Management projects which focused on digital enablement, culture and behavioral change. She has worked with clients in Australia, the US and the Netherlands.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible as first point of contact for US employees regarding benefits, payroll and employee information & processes. Duties include: 
•	System administration and data fidelity management for global headcount via SuccessFactors Employee Central
•	Managing US and Latin American life cycle processes & accompanying documentation (on-
        boarding, internal changes & off-boarding)
•	Managing self-service open enrollment, as well as benefit carrier & broker relationships year-
        round
•	Optimize and maintain communication between HR and payroll departments in US and Israel for semi-monthly payroll processing
•	Participate in the Austin “Culture Club,” responsible for community outreach & office event 
        coordination
•	Provide direction to field employees regarding benefits & payroll, in addition to regional employee 
        relations in Austin office
•	Backfill generation & distribution of monthly global headcount reporting for executive leadership
profile_positions.title: HR Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Individually responsible for annual budget in excess of $1MM encompassing artistic salaries, union dues, health plan/pension contributions as well as visiting artist transportation & accommodation. Duties included: 
•	Recruiting of more than 500 artistic direct reports (local, national and international)
•	Contract negotiation & preparation for artists and service providers
•	Preparation and delivery of initial on-boarding & orientation regarding company policies
•	Mediated and managed employee relations issues concerned with artistic employees
•	Weekly payroll tracking and reporting
•	Consistent high-volume project management requiring masterful multitasking

volunteer_experiences.description:
Represented Deloitte Australia as one of 10 staff volunteers at the 2018 Invictus Games, for wounded, ill or injured servicepeople across 18 countries.

Duties included:  Medals and Sports Presentation Team Lead
- Managing broadcast journalist team while sourcing on-site interviews with people of interest broadcast to live audience for Cycling, Sailing, Wheelchair Basketball and Archery
- Logistics and behind-the-scenes management of the medals presentation for the Swimming Competition, which involved handing out over 120 medals for individual and team events over 7 hours.

This initiative is an imperative way to help secure Deloitte's unfair share of female STEM talent and showcase what a career in STEM can look like based on mentor's experiences.

Program includes mentoring meetings, CV and Resume optimization and shadowing opportunities.

Organized calling campaigns for the YES campaign for Marriage Equality, ensuring that Australians are aware of the timelines for the postal ballot, and have the resources they need to return their ballots appropriately. Coordinated callers and oriented them on talking points

Produced the 2013, 2014 & 2015 HRC Austin Gala at the Four Seasons Hotel and JW Marriott for 450 - 600 attendees. Managed all aspects of production budget and vendor relations. Provided creative guidance and input to create comprehensive and original performance elements during the event. Managed a team of 16 creative and 13 production personnel. Participated in 8-month planning cycle.
